Posted By: atemu1234 (9/22/2012 7:51:45 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think every planeswalker had a creature/character who inspired them. Excluding [Karn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn), [Nicol Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas), and [Venser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser), who were inspired by their own card and character. In my opinion, I think it would go like this:  
  
**[Chandra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra)-[Jaya Ballard, Task Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jaya Ballard, Task Mage):** Both are red aligned hot headed pyromaniac women who love to set stuff on fire.  
  
**[Jace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace)- [Arcanis the Omnipotent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Arcanis the Omnipotent):** Both are blue aligned wizards specializing in mind powers and mental dominance.  
  
**[Ajani](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani)-Lord Windgrace:** Lord Windgrace was one of the planeswalkers who joined with Urza to fight against the Phyrexians. You can see him on the cards [Planeswalker's Fury](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Planeswalker's Fury) and [Divine Light](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divine Light). Although Plainswalkers of that time were not color associated, Lord Windgrace is considered to be mostly red and white, like Ajani. Lord Windgace c... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I think every planeswalker had a creature/character who inspired them. Excluding Karn, Nicol Bolas, and Venser, who were inspired by their own card and character. In my opinion, I think it would go like this:

Chandra-Jaya Ballard, Task Mage: Both are red aligned hot headed pyromaniac women who love to set stuff on fire.

Jace- Arcanis the Omnipotent: Both are blue aligned wizards specializing in mind powers and mental dominance.

Ajani-Lord Windgrace: Lord Windgrace was one of the planeswalkers who joined with Urza to fight against the Phyrexians. You can see him on the cards Planeswalker's Fury and Divine Light. Although Plainswalkers of that time were not color associated, Lord Windgrace is considered to be mostly red and white, like Ajani. Lord Windgace c... (see all)

Posted By: Geraume (5/10/2012 10:47:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The original "planeswalker" card. I'd like to see her return in future sets - I doubt she'd be a planeswalker, but she could be a powerful creature with abilities that get stronger the more mana you have, much like this card. Also holds the distinction of having some of the best attributed flavor text in the game.
